headline: L3Harris Accelerates ‘Arsenal of Freedom’ with Creation of a New Missile Solutions Company
summary: WASHINGTON, January 13, 2026--L3Harris Technologies (NYSE: LHX) has announced a first-of-its-kind proposed partnership with the Department of War (DoW) to significantly increase capacity to build solid rocket motors that power vital U.S. and allied missiles.

content.title: L3Harris Accelerates ‘Arsenal of Freedom’ with Creation of a New Missile Solutions Company
content.summary: WASHINGTON, January 13, 2026--L3Harris Technologies (NYSE: LHX) has announced a first-of-its-kind proposed partnership with the Department of War (DoW) to significantly increase capacity to build solid rocket motors that power vital U.S. and allied missiles.

headline: Pentagon Investing $1 Billion in L3Harris’ Rocket Motor Business
summary: L3Harris Technologies plans to spin off its missile business into a separate publicly traded company backed by a $1 billion investment from the Defense Department.

content.title: Pentagon Investing $1 Billion in L3Harris’ Rocket Motor Business
content.summary: L3Harris Technologies plans to spin off its missile business into a separate publicly traded company backed by a $1 billion investment from the Defense Department.

headline: Pentagon to invest $1 billion in L3Harris rocket motor business
summary: The deal represents the latest U.S. government investment in Corporate America.

content.title: Pentagon to invest $1 billion in L3Harris rocket motor business
content.summary: The deal represents the latest U.S. government investment in Corporate America.

headline: L3Harris secures $1B Pentagon contract, oil prices rise
summary: Morning Brief Host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including major bank JPMorgan Chase (JPM) reporting a decline in banking revenue, L3Harris Technologies (LHX) securing a $1 billion investment from the Pentagon, and oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) rising in connection to geopolitical tensions in Iran. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: L3Harris secures $1B Pentagon contract, oil prices rise

Morning Brief Host Julie Hyman tracks several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including major bank JPMorgan Chase (JPM) reporting a decline in banking revenue, L3Harris Technologies (LHX) securing a $1 billion investment from the Pentagon, and oil prices (CL=F, BZ=F) rising in connection to geopolitical tensions in Iran.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: L3Harris Rallies On $1 Billion DoD Investment, Missile IPO Plans
summary: The Trump Admin to invest $1 billion in L3Harris, take ownership stake in spinout of missile business. LHX stock soars to record highs.

content.title: L3Harris Rallies On $1 Billion DoD Investment, Missile IPO Plans

headline: L3 Harris Stock Soars. It’s Building an ‘Arsenal of Freedom’ With the U.S.—and Launching an IPO.
summary: President Donald Trump’s mantra of peace through strength will include investing directly in missile production with  L3Harris Technologies  Its stock is flying.  L3Harris is one of the largest makers of solid rocket motors, which propel missiles.

headline: L3 Harris Stock Rises. It’s Building an ‘Arsenal of Freedom’ With the U.S.—and Launching an IPO.
summary: President Donald Trump’s mantra of peace through strength will include investing directly in missile production with  L3Harris Technologies  Its stock is flying.  L3Harris is one of the largest makers of solid rocket motors, which propel missiles.  “The key conclusion from this announcement is in the final statement– unlocking meaningful value,” wrote Vertical Research Partners analyst Rob Stallard on Tuesday, pointing out that higher-growth businesses, such as missile production, are often embedded in slower-growing defense conglomerates.

content.title: L3 Harris Stock Rises. It’s Building an ‘Arsenal of Freedom’ With the U.S.—and Launching an IPO.
content.summary: President Donald Trump’s mantra of peace through strength will include investing directly in missile production with  L3Harris Technologies  Its stock is flying.  L3Harris is one of the largest makers of solid rocket motors, which propel missiles.  “The key conclusion from this announcement is in the final statement– unlocking meaningful value,” wrote Vertical Research Partners analyst Rob Stallard on Tuesday, pointing out that higher-growth businesses, such as missile production, are often embedded in slower-growing defense conglomerates.

headline: Pentagon Investing $1 Billion in L3Harris’s Rocket Motor Business
summary: The defense contractor plans an IPO for the unit that supplies parts for missiles for the U.S. and its allies.

headline: Stocks to Watch Tuesday: JPMorgan, Delta, L3Harris
summary: ↘️JPMorgan Chase (JPM): The Wall Street bastion posted a 7% drop in quarterly profit, while revenue missed forecasts. Investment-banking fees fell. JPMorgan took an extra $2.2 billion charge for potential futures losses related to buying Apple (AAPL)'s credit-card program.

headline: Vinson & Elkins Advises L3Harris on Partnership with Department of War
summary: By Daniella Parra Vinson & Elkins said it is representing L3Harris Technologies (NYSE: LHX) in connection with its proposed partnership with the U.S. Department of War. L3Harris and the DoW agreed to the terms of a proposed DoW investment in L3Harris’ Missile Solutions business through a $1 billion convertible preferred security, which would automatically convert […]
